page.title: 15WRENINGHAM RACEWAY
page.content: Excesses of milk & cereals in the 80's caused farming to change,making way for leisure pursuits.What better use for grassland than to create{a half {mile trotting track.}White-railed & attractive it stands on Bothway's land behind the village street.There,during light summer evenings,the horse fancy come in their huge lumbering boxes bringing trotters & sulkies.Practice runs create excitement in the large crowds;the bookies call their betting odds.The races begin.Flying hooves, creaking wheels,crouching drivers urg- ing on straining ponies.The commentat- or shouts:tension mounts,until a horse streaks past the winning post.The crowd gasps & then relaxes until the next event.The light goes,races pass, the boxes lumber homewards as do the crowds.The green grass & white rails shine in the moonlight till next time.
